refnamediv.refpurpose: A widget for displaying both trees and lists

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "enable-grid-lines" GtkTreeViewGridLines : Read / Write "enable-search" gboolean : Read / Write "enable-tree-lines" gboolean : Read / Write "expander-column" GtkTreeViewColumn* : Read / Write "fixed-height-mode" gboolean : Read / Write "hadjustment" GtkAdjustment* : Read / Write "headers-clickable" gboolean : Read / Write "headers-visible" gboolean : Read / Write "hover-expand" gboolean : Read / Write "hover-selection" gboolean : Read / Write "level-indentation" gint : Read / Write "model" GtkTreeModel* : Read / Write "reorderable" gboolean : Read / Write "rubber-banding" gboolean : Read / Write "rules-hint" gboolean : Read / Write "search-column" gint : Read / Write "show-expanders" gboolean : Read / Write "tooltip-column" gint : Read / Write "vadjustment" GtkAdjustment* : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Style Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "allow-rules" gboolean : Read "even-row-color" GdkColor* : Read "expander-size" gint : Read "grid-line-pattern" gchar* : Read "grid-line-width" gint : Read "horizontal-separator" gint : Read "indent-expanders" gboolean : Read "odd-row-color" GdkColor* : Read "row-ending-details" gboolean : Read "tree-line-pattern" gchar* : Read "tree-line-width" gint : Read "vertical-separator" gint : Read

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "columns-changed" : Run Last "cursor-changed" : Run Last "expand-collapse-cursor-row" : Run Last / Action "move-cursor" : Run Last / Action "row-activated" : Run Last / Action "row-collapsed" : Run Last "row-expanded" : Run Last "select-all" : Run Last / Action "select-cursor-parent" : Run Last / Action "select-cursor-row" : Run Last / Action "set-scroll-adjustments" : Run Last / Action "start-interactive-search" : Run Last / Action "test-collapse-row" : Run Last "test-expand-row" : Run Last "toggle-cursor-row" : Run Last / Action "unselect-all" : Run Last / Action

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Widget that displays any object that implements the GtkTreeModel interface.
Please refer to the tree widget conceptual overview for an overview of all the objects and data types related to the tree widget and how they work together.

Several different coordinate systems are exposed in the GtkTreeView API. These are:
Widget coordinates -- coordinates relative to the widget (usually widget->window. Bin window coordinates -- coordinates relative to the window that GtkTreeView renders to. Tree coordinates -- coordinates relative to the entire scrollable area of GtkTreeView. These coordinates start at (0, 0) for row 0 of the tree.

Several functions are available for converting between the different coordinate systems. The most common translations are between widget and bin window coordinates and between bin window and tree coordinates. For the former you can use gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords() (and vice versa), for the latter gtk_tree_view_convert_bin_window_to_tree_coords() (and vice versa).

refsect2.title: GtkTreeView as GtkBuildable
refsect2.para: The GtkTreeView implementation of the GtkBuildable interface accepts GtkTreeViewColumn objects as <child> elements in UI definitions.

example.title: A UI definition fragment with GtkTreeView
example.programlisting: <object class="GtkTreeView" id="treeview"> <property name="model">liststore1</property> <child> <object class="GtkTreeViewColumn" id="test-column"> <property name="title">Test</property> <child> <object class="GtkCellRendererText" id="test-renderer"/> <attributes> <attribute name="text">1</attribute> </attributes> </child> </object> </child> </object>

refsect2.title: enum GtkTreeViewDropPosition
refsect2.para: An enum for determining where a dropped row goes.

listitem.simpara: dropped row is inserted before
dropped row is inserted after
dropped row becomes a child or is inserted before
dropped row becomes a child or is inserted after

refsect2.title: GtkTreeViewPrivate
refsect2.para: A private struct for internal use only. The definition of this structure is not publically available.

refsect2.title: GtkTreeViewColumnDropFunc ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean (*GtkTreeViewColumnDropFunc) (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeViewColumn *column, GtkTreeViewColumn *prev_column, GtkTreeViewColumn *next_column, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Function type for determining whether column can be dropped in a particular spot (as determined by prev_column and next_column). In left to right locales, prev_column is on the left of the potential drop spot, and next_column is on the right. In right to left mode, this is reversed. This function should return TRUE if the spot is a valid drop spot. Please note that returning TRUE does not actually indicate that the column drop was made, but is meant only to indicate a possible drop spot to the user.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
The GtkTreeViewColumn being dragged
A GtkTreeViewColumn on one side of column
A GtkTreeViewColumn on the other side of column
user data
%TRUE, if column can be dropped in this spot

refsect2.title: GtkTreeViewMappingFunc ()
refsect2.para: Function used for gtk_tree_view_map_expanded_rows.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
The path that's expanded
user data

refsect2.title: GtkTreeViewSearchEqualFunc ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean (*GtkTreeViewSearchEqualFunc) (GtkTreeModel *model, gint column, const gchar *key, GtkTreeIter *iter, gpointer search_data);
refsect2.para: A function used for checking whether a row in model matches a search key string entered by the user. Note the return value is reversed from what you would normally expect, though it has some similarity to strcmp() returning 0 for equal strings.

listitem.simpara: the GtkTreeModel being searched
the search column set by gtk_tree_view_set_search_column()
the key string to compare with
a GtkTreeIter pointing the row of model that should be compared with key.
user data from gtk_tree_view_set_search_equal_func()
%FALSE if the row matches, TRUE otherwise.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkTreeView widget.

listitem.simpara: A newly created GtkTreeView widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_level_indentation ()
refsect2.para: Returns the amount, in pixels, of extra indentation for child levels in tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView.
the amount of extra indentation for child levels in tree_view. A return value of 0 means that this feature is disabled.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_show_expanders ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether or not expanders are drawn in tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView.
TRUE if expanders are drawn in tree_view, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_level_indentation ()
refsect2.para: Sets the amount of extra indentation for child levels to use in tree_view in addition to the default indentation. The value should be specified in pixels, a value of 0 disables this feature and in this case only the default indentation will be used. This does not have any visible effects for lists.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
the amount, in pixels, of extra indentation in tree_view.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_show_expanders ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether to draw and enable expanders and indent child rows in tree_view. When disabled there will be no expanders visible in trees and there will be no way to expand and collapse rows by default. Also note that hiding the expanders will disable the default indentation. You can set a custom indentation in this case using gtk_tree_view_set_level_indentation(). This does not have any visible effects for lists.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE to enable expander drawing, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_new_with_model ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkTreeView widget with the model initialized to model.

listitem.simpara: the model.
A newly created GtkTreeView widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_model ()
refsect2.para: Returns the model the GtkTreeView is based on. Returns NULL if the model is unset.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
A GtkTreeModel, or NULL if none is currently being used.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_model ()
refsect2.para: Sets the model for a GtkTreeView. If the tree_view already has a model set, it will remove it before setting the new model. If model is NULL, then it will unset the old model.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeNode.
The model.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_selection ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkTreeSelection associated with tree_view.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
A GtkTreeSelection object.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_hadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkAdjustment currently being used for the horizontal aspect.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
A GtkAdjustment object, or NULL if none is currently being used.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_hadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the GtkAdjustment for the current horizontal aspect.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
The GtkAdjustment to set, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_vadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkAdjustment currently being used for the vertical aspect.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
A GtkAdjustment object, or NULL if none is currently being used.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_vadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the GtkAdjustment for the current vertical aspect.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
The GtkAdjustment to set, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_headers_visible ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the headers on the tree_view are visible.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
Whether the headers are visible or not.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_headers_visible ()
refsect2.para: Sets the visibility state of the headers.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
TRUE if the headers are visible

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_columns_autosize ()
refsect2.para: Resizes all columns to their optimal width. Only works after the treeview has been realized.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_headers_clickable ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether all header columns are clickable.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
TRUE if all header columns are clickable, otherwise FALSE

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_headers_clickable ()
refsect2.para: Allow the column title buttons to be clicked.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
TRUE if the columns are clickable.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_rules_hint ()
refsect2.para: This function tells GTK+ that the user interface for your application requires users to read across tree rows and associate cells with one another. By default, GTK+ will then render the tree with alternating row colors. Do not use it just because you prefer the appearance of the ruled tree; that's a question for the theme. Some themes will draw tree rows in alternating colors even when rules are turned off, and users who prefer that appearance all the time can choose those themes. You should call this function only as a semantic hint to the theme engine that your tree makes alternating colors useful from a functional standpoint (since it has lots of columns, generally).

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE if the tree requires reading across rows

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_rules_hint ()
refsect2.para: Gets the setting set by gtk_tree_view_set_rules_hint().

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE if rules are useful for the user of this tree

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_append_column ()
refsect2.para: Appends column to the list of columns. If tree_view has "fixed_height" mode enabled, then column must have its "sizing" property set to be GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
The GtkTreeViewColumn to add.
The number of columns in tree_view after appending.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_remove_column ()
refsect2.para: Removes column from tree_view.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
The GtkTreeViewColumn to remove.
The number of columns in tree_view after removing.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_insert_column ()
refsect2.para: This inserts the column into the tree_view at position. If position is -1, then the column is inserted at the end. If tree_view has "fixed_height" mode enabled, then column must have its "sizing" property set to be GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
The GtkTreeViewColumn to be inserted.
The position to insert column in.
The number of columns in tree_view after insertion.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_insert_column_with_attributes ()
refsect2.programlisting: gint gtk_tree_view_insert_column_with_attributes (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint position, const gchar *title, GtkCellRenderer *cell, ...);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkTreeViewColumn and inserts it into the tree_view at position. If position is -1, then the newly created column is inserted at the end. The column is initialized with the attributes given. If tree_view has "fixed_height" mode enabled, then the new column will have its sizing property set to be GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
The position to insert the new column in.
The title to set the header to.
The GtkCellRenderer.
A NULL-terminated list of attributes.
The number of columns in tree_view after insertion.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_insert_column_with_data_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: gint gtk_tree_view_insert_column_with_data_func (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint position, const gchar *title, GtkCellRenderer *cell, GtkTreeCellDataFunc func, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify dnotify);
refsect2.para: Convenience function that inserts a new column into the GtkTreeView with the given cell renderer and a GtkCellDataFunc to set cell renderer attributes (normally using data from the model). See also gtk_tree_view_column_set_cell_data_func(), gtk_tree_view_column_pack_start(). If tree_view has "fixed_height" mode enabled, then the new column will have its "sizing" property set to be GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
Position to insert, -1 for append
column title
cell renderer for column
function to set attributes of cell renderer
data for func
destroy notifier for data
number of columns in the tree view post-insert

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_column ()
refsect2.para: Gets the GtkTreeViewColumn at the given position in the tree_view.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
The position of the column, counting from 0.
The GtkTreeViewColumn, or NULL if the position is outside the range of columns.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_columns ()
refsect2.para: Returns a GList of all the GtkTreeViewColumn s currently in tree_view. The returned list must be freed with g_list_free().

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
A list of GtkTreeViewColumn s

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_move_column_after ()
refsect2.para: Moves column to be after to base_column. If base_column is NULL, then column is placed in the first position.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
The GtkTreeViewColumn to be moved.
The GtkTreeViewColumn to be moved relative to, or NULL.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_expander_column ()
refsect2.para: Sets the column to draw the expander arrow at. It must be in tree_view. If column is NULL, then the expander arrow is always at the first visible column.
If you do not want expander arrow to appear in your tree, set the expander column to a hidden column.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
NULL, or the column to draw the expander arrow at.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_expander_column ()
refsect2.para: Returns the column that is the current expander column. This column has the expander arrow drawn next to it.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
The expander column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_column_drag_function ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_set_column_drag_function (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeViewColumnDropFunc func, gpointer user_data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets a user function for determining where a column may be dropped when dragged. This function is called on every column pair in turn at the beginning of a column drag to determine where a drop can take place. The arguments passed to func are: the tree_view, the GtkTreeViewColumn being dragged, the two GtkTreeViewColumn s determining the drop spot, and user_data. If either of the GtkTreeViewColumn arguments for the drop spot are NULL, then they indicate an edge. If func is set to be NULL, then tree_view reverts to the default behavior of allowing all columns to be dropped everywhere.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
A function to determine which columns are reorderable, or NULL.
User data to be passed to func, or NULL
Destroy notifier for user_data, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_scroll_to_point ()
refsect2.para: Scrolls the tree view such that the top-left corner of the visible area is tree_x, tree_y, where tree_x and tree_y are specified in tree coordinates. The tree_view must be realized before this function is called. If it isn't, you probably want to be using gtk_tree_view_scroll_to_cell().
If either tree_x or tree_y are -1, then that direction isn't scrolled.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
X coordinate of new top-left pixel of visible area, or -1
Y coordinate of new top-left pixel of visible area, or -1

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_scroll_to_cell ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_scroll_to_cell (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreePath *path, GtkTreeViewColumn *column, gboolean use_align, gfloat row_align, gfloat col_align);
refsect2.para: Moves the alignments of tree_view to the position specified by column and path. If column is NULL, then no horizontal scrolling occurs. Likewise, if path is NULL no vertical scrolling occurs. At a minimum, one of column or path need to be non-NULL. row_align determines where the row is placed, and col_align determines where column is placed. Both are expected to be between 0.0 and 1.0. 0.0 means left/top alignment, 1.0 means right/bottom alignment, 0.5 means center.

If use_align is FALSE, then the alignment arguments are ignored, and the tree does the minimum amount of work to scroll the cell onto the screen. This means that the cell will be scrolled to the edge closest to its current position. If the cell is currently visible on the screen, nothing is done.
This function only works if the model is set, and path is a valid row on the model. If the model changes before the tree_view is realized, the centered path will be modified to reflect this change.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
The path of the row to move to, or NULL.
The GtkTreeViewColumn to move horizontally to, or NULL.
whether to use alignment arguments, or FALSE.
The vertical alignment of the row specified by path.
The horizontal alignment of the column specified by column.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_cursor ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_set_cursor (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreePath *path, GtkTreeViewColumn *focus_column, gboolean start_editing);
refsect2.para: Sets the current keyboard focus to be at path, and selects it. This is useful when you want to focus the user's attention on a particular row. If focus_column is not NULL, then focus is given to the column specified by it. Additionally, if focus_column is specified, and start_editing is TRUE, then editing should be started in the specified cell. This function is often followed by gtk_widget_grab_focus (tree_view) in order to give keyboard focus to the widget. Please note that editing can only happen when the widget is realized.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
A GtkTreePath
A GtkTreeViewColumn, or NULL
TRUE if the specified cell should start being edited.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_cursor_on_cell ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_set_cursor_on_cell (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreePath *path, GtkTreeViewColumn *focus_column, GtkCellRenderer *focus_cell, gboolean start_editing);
refsect2.para: Sets the current keyboard focus to be at path, and selects it. This is useful when you want to focus the user's attention on a particular row. If focus_column is not NULL, then focus is given to the column specified by it. If focus_column and focus_cell are not NULL, and focus_column contains 2 or more editable or activatable cells, then focus is given to the cell specified by focus_cell. Additionally, if focus_column is specified, and start_editing is TRUE, then editing should be started in the specified cell. This function is often followed by gtk_widget_grab_focus (tree_view) in order to give keyboard focus to the widget. Please note that editing can only happen when the widget is realized.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
A GtkTreePath
A GtkTreeViewColumn, or NULL
A GtkCellRenderer, or NULL
TRUE if the specified cell should start being edited.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_cursor ()
refsect2.para: Fills in path and focus_column with the current path and focus column. If the cursor isn't currently set, then *path will be NULL. If no column currently has focus, then *focus_column will be NULL.
The returned GtkTreePath must be freed with gtk_tree_path_free() when you are done with it.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
A pointer to be filled with the current cursor path, or NULL
A pointer to be filled with the current focus column, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_row_activated ()
refsect2.para: Activates the cell determined by path and column.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
The GtkTreePath to be activated.
The GtkTreeViewColumn to be activated.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_expand_all ()
refsect2.para: Recursively expands all nodes in the tree_view.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_collapse_all ()
refsect2.para: Recursively collapses all visible, expanded nodes in tree_view.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_expand_to_path ()
refsect2.para: Expands the row at path. This will also expand all parent rows of path as necessary.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
path to a row.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_expand_row ()
refsect2.para: Opens the row so its children are visible.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
path to a row
whether to recursively expand, or just expand immediate children
TRUE if the row existed and had children

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_collapse_row ()
refsect2.para: Collapses a row (hides its child rows, if they exist).

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
path to a row in the tree_view
TRUE if the row was collapsed.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_map_expanded_rows ()
refsect2.para: Calls func on all expanded rows.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
A function to be called
User data to be passed to the function.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_row_expanded ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the node pointed to by path is expanded in tree_view.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
A GtkTreePath to test expansion state.
TRUE if path is expanded.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_reorderable ()
refsect2.para: This function is a convenience function to allow you to reorder models that support the GtkDragSourceIface and the GtkDragDestIface. Both GtkTreeStore and GtkListStore support these. If reorderable is TRUE, then the user can reorder the model by dragging and dropping rows. The developer can listen to these changes by connecting to the model's row_inserted and row_deleted signals. The reordering is implemented by setting up the tree view as a drag source and destination. Therefore, drag and drop can not be used in a reorderable view for any other purpose.
This function does not give you any degree of control over the order -- any reordering is allowed. If more control is needed, you should probably handle drag and drop manually.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
TRUE, if the tree can be reordered.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_reorderable ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves whether the user can reorder the tree via drag-and-drop. See gtk_tree_view_set_reorderable().

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE if the tree can be reordered.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_path_at_pos ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_tree_view_get_path_at_pos (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint x, gint y, GtkTreePath **path, GtkTreeViewColumn **column, gint *cell_x, gint *cell_y);
refsect2.para: Finds the path at the point (x, y), relative to bin_window coordinates (please see gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window()). That is, x and y are relative to an events coordinates. x and y must come from an event on the tree_view only where event->window == gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window (). It is primarily for things like popup menus. If path is non-NULL, then it will be filled with the GtkTreePath at that point. This path should be freed with gtk_tree_path_free(). If column is non-NULL, then it will be filled with the column at that point. cell_x and cell_y return the coordinates relative to the cell background (i.e. the background_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render()). This function is only meaningful if tree_view is realized.
For converting widget coordinates (eg. the ones you get from GtkWidget::query-tooltip), please see gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords().

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView.
The x position to be identified (relative to bin_window).
The y position to be identified (relative to bin_window).
A pointer to a GtkTreePath pointer to be filled in, or NULL
A pointer to a GtkTreeViewColumn pointer to be filled in, or NULL
A pointer where the X coordinate relative to the cell can be placed, or NULL
A pointer where the Y coordinate relative to the cell can be placed, or NULL
TRUE if a row exists at that coordinate.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_cell_area ()
refsect2.para: Fills the bounding rectangle in bin_window coordinates for the cell at the row specified by path and the column specified by column. If path is NULL, or points to a path not currently displayed, the y and height fields of the rectangle will be filled with 0. If column is NULL, the x and width fields will be filled with 0. The sum of all cell rects does not cover the entire tree; there are extra pixels in between rows, for example. The returned rectangle is equivalent to the cell_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render(). This function is only valid if tree_view is realized.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
a GtkTreePath for the row, or NULL to get only horizontal coordinates
a GtkTreeViewColumn for the column, or NULL to get only vertical coordinates
rectangle to fill with cell rect

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_background_area ()
refsect2.para: Fills the bounding rectangle in bin_window coordinates for the cell at the row specified by path and the column specified by column. If path is NULL, or points to a node not found in the tree, the y and height fields of the rectangle will be filled with 0. If column is NULL, the x and width fields will be filled with 0. The returned rectangle is equivalent to the background_area passed to gtk_cell_renderer_render(). These background areas tile to cover the entire bin window. Contrast with the cell_area, returned by gtk_tree_view_get_cell_area(), which returns only the cell itself, excluding surrounding borders and the tree expander area.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
a GtkTreePath for the row, or NULL to get only horizontal coordinates
a GtkTreeViewColumn for the column, or NULL to get only vertical coordiantes
rectangle to fill with cell background rect

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_visible_rect ()
refsect2.para: Fills visible_rect with the currently-visible region of the buffer, in tree coordinates. Convert to bin_window coordinates with gtk_tree_view_convert_tree_to_bin_window_coords(). Tree coordinates start at 0,0 for row 0 of the tree, and cover the entire scrollable area of the tree.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
rectangle to fill

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_visible_range ()
refsect2.para: Sets start_path and end_path to be the first and last visible path. Note that there may be invisible paths in between.
The paths should be freed with gtk_tree_path_free() after use.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
Return location for start of region, or NULL.
Return location for end of region, or NULL.
TRUE, if valid paths were placed in start_path and end_path.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window ()
refsect2.para: Returns the window that tree_view renders to. This is used primarily to compare to event->window to confirm that the event on tree_view is on the right window.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
A GdkWindow, or NULL when tree_view hasn't been realized yet

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_widget_to_tree_coords ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_widget_to_tree_coords (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint wx, gint wy, gint *tx, gint *ty);

warning.para: gtk_tree_view_widget_to_tree_coords has been deprecated since version 2.12 and should not be used in newly-written code. Due to historial reasons the name of this function is incorrect. For converting coordinates relative to the widget to bin_window coordinates, please see gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords().

refsect2.para: Converts bin_window coordinates to coordinates for the tree (the full scrollable area of the tree).

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
X coordinate relative to bin_window
Y coordinate relative to bin_window
return location for tree X coordinate
return location for tree Y coordinate

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_tree_to_widget_coords ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_tree_to_widget_coords (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint tx, gint ty, gint *wx, gint *wy);

warning.para: gtk_tree_view_tree_to_widget_coords has been deprecated since version 2.12 and should not be used in newly-written code. Due to historial reasons the name of this function is incorrect. For converting bin_window coordinates to coordinates relative to bin_window, please see gtk_tree_view_convert_bin_window_to_widget_coords().

refsect2.para: Converts tree coordinates (coordinates in full scrollable area of the tree) to bin_window coordinates.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
tree X coordinate
tree Y coordinate
return location for X coordinate relative to bin_window
return location for Y coordinate relative to bin_window

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_convert_bin_window_to_tree_coords ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_convert_bin_window_to_tree_coords (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint bx, gint by, gint *tx, gint *ty);
refsect2.para: Converts bin_window coordinates to coordinates for the tree (the full scrollable area of the tree).

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
X coordinate relative to bin_window
Y coordinate relative to bin_window
return location for tree X coordinate
return location for tree Y coordinate

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_convert_bin_window_to_widget_coords ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_convert_bin_window_to_widget_coords (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint bx, gint by, gint *wx, gint *wy);
refsect2.para: Converts bin_window coordinates (see gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window()) to widget relative coordinates.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
bin_window X coordinate
bin_window Y coordinate
return location for widget X coordinate
return location for widget Y coordinate

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_convert_tree_to_bin_window_coords ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_convert_tree_to_bin_window_coords (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint tx, gint ty, gint *bx, gint *by);
refsect2.para: Converts tree coordinates (coordinates in full scrollable area of the tree) to bin_window coordinates.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
tree X coordinate
tree Y coordinate
return location for X coordinate relative to bin_window
return location for Y coordinate relative to bin_window

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_convert_tree_to_widget_coords ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_convert_tree_to_widget_coords (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint tx, gint ty, gint *wx, gint *wy);
refsect2.para: Converts tree coordinates (coordinates in full scrollable area of the tree) to widget coordinates.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
X coordinate relative to the tree
Y coordinate relative to the tree
return location for widget X coordinate
return location for widget Y coordinate

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_bin_window_coords (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint wx, gint wy, gint *bx, gint *by);
refsect2.para: Converts widget coordinates to coordinates for the bin_window (see gtk_tree_view_get_bin_window()).

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
X coordinate relative to the widget
Y coordinate relative to the widget
return location for bin_window X coordinate
return location for bin_window Y coordinate

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_tree_coords ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_convert_widget_to_tree_coords (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint wx, gint wy, gint *tx, gint *ty);
refsect2.para: Converts widget coordinates to coordinates for the tree (the full scrollable area of the tree).

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
X coordinate relative to the widget
Y coordinate relative to the widget
return location for tree X coordinate
return location for tree Y coordinate

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_dest ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_dest (GtkTreeView *tree_view, const GtkTargetEntry *targets, gint n_targets, GdkDragAction actions);
refsect2.para: Turns tree_view into a drop destination for automatic DND. Calling this method sets "reorderable" to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
the table of targets that the drag will support
the number of items in targets
the bitmask of possible actions for a drag from this widget

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_source ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_source (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GdkModifierType start_button_mask, const GtkTargetEntry *targets, gint n_targets, GdkDragAction actions);
refsect2.para: Turns tree_view into a drag source for automatic DND. Calling this method sets "reorderable" to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
Mask of allowed buttons to start drag
the table of targets that the drag will support
the number of items in targets
the bitmask of possible actions for a drag from this widget

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_unset_rows_drag_source ()
refsect2.para: Undoes the effect of gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_source(). Calling this method sets "reorderable" to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_unset_rows_drag_dest ()
refsect2.para: Undoes the effect of gtk_tree_view_enable_model_drag_dest(). Calling this method sets "reorderable" to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_drag_dest_row ()
refsect2.para: Sets the row that is highlighted for feedback.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
The path of the row to highlight, or NULL.
Specifies whether to drop before, after or into the row

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_drag_dest_row ()
refsect2.para: Gets information about the row that is highlighted for feedback.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
Return location for the path of the highlighted row, or NULL.
Return location for the drop position, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_dest_row_at_pos ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_tree_view_get_dest_row_at_pos (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint drag_x, gint drag_y, GtkTreePath **path, GtkTreeViewDropPosition *pos);
refsect2.para: Determines the destination row for a given position. drag_x and drag_y are expected to be in widget coordinates.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
the position to determine the destination row for
the position to determine the destination row for
Return location for the path of the highlighted row, or NULL.
Return location for the drop position, or NULL
whether there is a row at the given position.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_create_row_drag_icon ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GdkPixmap representation of the row at path. This image is used for a drag icon.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
a GtkTreePath in tree_view
a newly-allocated pixmap of the drag icon.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_enable_search ()
refsect2.para: If enable_search is set, then the user can type in text to search through the tree interactively (this is sometimes called "typeahead find").
Note that even if this is FALSE, the user can still initiate a search using the "start-interactive-search" key binding.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
TRUE, if the user can search interactively

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_enable_search ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether or not the tree allows to start interactive searching by typing in text.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
whether or not to let the user search interactively

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_search_column ()
refsect2.para: Gets the column searched on by the interactive search code.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
the column the interactive search code searches in.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_search_column ()
refsect2.para: Sets column as the column where the interactive search code should search in for the current model.

If the search column is set, users can use the "start-interactive-search" key binding to bring up search popup. The enable-search property controls whether simply typing text will also start an interactive search.
Note that column refers to a column of the current model. The search column is reset to -1 when the model is changed.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
the column of the model to search in, or -1 to disable searching

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_search_equal_func ()
refsect2.para: Returns the compare function currently in use.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
the currently used compare function for the search code.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_search_equal_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_set_search_equal_func (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeViewSearchEqualFunc search_equal_func, gpointer search_user_data, GDestroyNotify search_destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the compare function for the interactive search capabilities; note that somewhat like strcmp() returning 0 for equality GtkTreeViewSearchEqualFunc returns FALSE on matches.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
the compare function to use during the search
user data to pass to search_equal_func, or NULL
Destroy notifier for search_user_data, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_search_entry ()
refsect2.para: Returns the GtkEntry which is currently in use as interactive search entry for tree_view. In case the built-in entry is being used, NULL will be returned.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
the entry currently in use as search entry.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_search_entry ()
refsect2.para: Sets the entry which the interactive search code will use for this tree_view. This is useful when you want to provide a search entry in our interface at all time at a fixed position. Passing NULL for entry will make the interactive search code use the built-in popup entry again.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
the entry the interactive search code of tree_view should use or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_search_position_func ()
refsect2.para: Returns the positioning function currently in use.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
the currently used function for positioning the search dialog.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_search_position_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_set_search_position_func (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeViewSearchPositionFunc func, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the function to use when positioning the search dialog.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
the function to use to position the search dialog, or NULL to use the default search position function
user data to pass to func, or NULL
Destroy notifier for data, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_fixed_height_mode ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether fixed height mode is turned on for tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE if tree_view is in fixed height mode

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_fixed_height_mode ()
refsect2.para: Enables or disables the fixed height mode of tree_view. Fixed height mode speeds up GtkTreeView by assuming that all rows have the same height. Only enable this option if all rows are the same height and all columns are of type GTK_TREE_VIEW_COLUMN_FIXED.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE to enable fixed height mode

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_hover_selection ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether hover selection mode is turned on for tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE if tree_view is in hover selection mode

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_hover_selection ()
refsect2.para: Enables of disables the hover selection mode of tree_view. Hover selection makes the selected row follow the pointer. Currently, this works only for the selection modes GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE and GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE to enable hover selection mode

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_hover_expand ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether hover expansion mode is turned on for tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE if tree_view is in hover expansion mode

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_hover_expand ()
refsect2.para: Enables of disables the hover expansion mode of tree_view. Hover expansion makes rows expand or collapse if the pointer moves over them.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE to enable hover selection mode

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: GtkTreeDestroyCountFunc ()
refsect2.programlisting: void (*GtkTreeDestroyCountFunc) (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreePath *path, gint children, gpointer user_data);

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_destroy_count_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_set_destroy_count_func (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeDestroyCountFunc func, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: This function should almost never be used. It is meant for private use by ATK for determining the number of visible children that are removed when the user collapses a row, or a row is deleted.

listitem.simpara: A GtkTreeView
Function to be called when a view row is destroyed, or NULL
User data to be passed to func, or NULL
Destroy notifier for data, or NULL

refsect2.title: GtkTreeViewRowSeparatorFunc ()
refsect2.para: Function type for determining whether the row pointed to by iter should be rendered as a separator. A common way to implement this is to have a boolean column in the model, whose values the GtkTreeViewRowSeparatorFunc returns.

listitem.simpara: the GtkTreeModel
a GtkTreeIter pointing at a row in model
user data
%TRUE if the row is a separator

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_row_separator_func ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current row separator function.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
the current row separator function.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_row_separator_func ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_set_row_separator_func (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeViewRowSeparatorFunc func, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Sets the row separator function, which is used to determine whether a row should be drawn as a separator. If the row separator function is NULL, no separators are drawn. This is the default value.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
a GtkTreeViewRowSeparatorFunc
user data to pass to func, or NULL
destroy notifier for data, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_rubber_banding ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether rubber banding is turned on for tree_view. If the selection mode is GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, rubber banding will allow the user to select multiple rows by dragging the mouse.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE if rubber banding in tree_view is enabled.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_rubber_banding ()
refsect2.para: Enables or disables rubber banding in tree_view. If the selection mode is GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE, rubber banding will allow the user to select multiple rows by dragging the mouse.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE to enable rubber banding

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_is_rubber_banding_active ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether a rubber banding operation is currently being done in tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE if a rubber banding operation is currently being done in tree_view.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_enable_tree_lines ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether or not tree lines are drawn in tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView.
TRUE if tree lines are drawn in tree_view, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_enable_tree_lines ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether to draw lines interconnecting the expanders in tree_view. This does not have any visible effects for lists.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
TRUE to enable tree line drawing, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: enum GtkTreeViewGridLines
refsect2.para: Used to indicate which grid lines to draw in a tree view.

listitem.simpara: No grid lines.
Horizontal grid lines.
Vertical grid lines.
Horizontal and vertical grid lines.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_grid_lines ()
refsect2.para: Returns which grid lines are enabled in tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
a GtkTreeViewGridLines value indicating which grid lines are enabled.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_grid_lines ()
refsect2.para: Sets which grid lines to draw in tree_view.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
a GtkTreeViewGridLines value indicating which grid lines to enable.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_row ()
refsect2.para: Sets the tip area of tooltip to be the area covered by the row at path. See also gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_column() for a simpler alternative. See also gtk_tooltip_set_tip_area().

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
a GtkTooltip
a GtkTreePath

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_cell ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_cell (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTooltip *tooltip, GtkTreePath *path, GtkTreeViewColumn *column, GtkCellRenderer *cell);
refsect2.para: Sets the tip area of tooltip to the area path, column and cell have in common. For example if path is NULL and column is set, the tip area will be set to the full area covered by column. See also gtk_tooltip_set_tip_area().

Note that if path is not specified and cell is set and part of a column containing the expander, the tooltip might not show and hide at the correct position. In such cases path must be set to the current node under the mouse cursor for this function to operate correctly.
See also gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_column() for a simpler alternative.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
a GtkTooltip
a GtkTreePath or NULL
a GtkTreeViewColumn or NULL
a GtkCellRenderer or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_tooltip_context ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gtk_tree_view_get_tooltip_context (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gint *x, gint *y, gboolean keyboard_tip, GtkTreeModel **model, GtkTreePath **path, GtkTreeIter *iter);
refsect2.para: This function is supposed to be used in a "query-tooltip" signal handler for GtkTreeView. The x, y and keyboard_tip values which are received in the signal handler, should be passed to this function without modification.

The return value indicates whether there is a tree view row at the given coordinates (TRUE) or not (FALSE) for mouse tooltips. For keyboard tooltips the row returned will be the cursor row. When TRUE, then any of model, path and iter which have been provided will be set to point to that row and the corresponding model. x and y will always be converted to be relative to tree_view's bin_window if keyboard_tooltip is FALSE.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
the x coordinate (relative to widget coordinates)
the y coordinate (relative to widget coordinates)
whether this is a keyboard tooltip or not
a pointer to receive a GtkTreeModel or NULL
a pointer to receive a GtkTreePath or NULL
a pointer to receive a GtkTreeIter or NULL
whether or not the given tooltip context points to a row.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_get_tooltip_column ()
refsect2.para: Returns the column of tree_view's model which is being used for displaying tooltips on tree_view's rows.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
the index of the tooltip column that is currently being used, or -1 if this is disabled.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_view_set_tooltip_column ()
refsect2.para: If you only plan to have simple (text-only) tooltips on full rows, you can use this function to have GtkTreeView handle these automatically for you. column should be set to the column in tree_view's model containing the tooltip texts, or -1 to disable this feature.
When enabled, "has-tooltip" will be set to TRUE and tree_view will connect a "query-tooltip" signal handler.
Note that the signal handler sets the text with gtk_tooltip_set_markup(), so &, <, etc have to be escaped in the text.

listitem.simpara: a GtkTreeView
an integer, which is a valid column number for tree_view's model

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: The "enable-grid-lines" property
refsect2.para: Whether grid lines should be drawn in the tree view.
Default value: GTK_TREE_VIEW_GRID_LINES_NONE

refsect2.title: The "enable-search" property
refsect2.para: View allows user to search through columns interactively.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "enable-tree-lines" property
refsect2.para: Whether tree lines should be drawn in the tree view.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "expander-column" property
refsect2.para: Set the column for the expander column.

refsect2.title: The "fixed-height-mode" property
refsect2.para: Setting the ::fixed-height-mode property to TRUE speeds up GtkTreeView by assuming that all rows have the same height. Only enable this option if all rows are the same height. Please see gtk_tree_view_set_fixed_height_mode() for more information on this option.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The "hadjustment" property
refsect2.para: Horizontal Adjustment for the widget.

refsect2.title: The "headers-clickable" property
refsect2.para: Column headers respond to click events.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "headers-visible" property
refsect2.para: Show the column header buttons.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "hover-expand" property
refsect2.para: Enables of disables the hover expansion mode of tree_view. Hover expansion makes rows expand or collapse if the pointer moves over them.
This mode is primarily intended for treeviews in popups, e.g. in GtkComboBox or GtkEntryCompletion.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "hover-selection" property
refsect2.para: Enables of disables the hover selection mode of tree_view. Hover selection makes the selected row follow the pointer. Currently, this works only for the selection modes GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE and GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE.
This mode is primarily intended for treeviews in popups, e.g. in GtkComboBox or GtkEntryCompletion.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: The "level-indentation" property
refsect2.para: Extra indentation for each level.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 0
Since 2.12

refsect2.title: The "model" property
refsect2.para: The model for the tree view.

refsect2.title: The "reorderable" property
refsect2.para: View is reorderable.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "rubber-banding" property
refsect2.para: Whether to enable selection of multiple items by dragging the mouse pointer.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "rules-hint" property
refsect2.para: Set a hint to the theme engine to draw rows in alternating colors.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "search-column" property
refsect2.para: Model column to search through during interactive search.
Allowed values: >= G_MAXULONG
Default value: -1

refsect2.title: The "show-expanders" property
refsect2.para: TRUE if the view has expanders.
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.12

refsect2.title: The "tooltip-column" property
refsect2.para: The column in the model containing the tooltip texts for the rows.
Allowed values: >= G_MAXULONG
Default value: -1

refsect2.title: The "vadjustment" property
refsect2.para: Vertical Adjustment for the widget.

refsect2.title: The "allow-rules" style property
refsect2.para: Allow drawing of alternating color rows.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "even-row-color" style property
refsect2.para: Color to use for even rows.

refsect2.title: The "expander-size" style property
refsect2.para: Size of the expander arrow.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 12

refsect2.title: The "grid-line-pattern" style property
refsect2.para: Dash pattern used to draw the tree view grid lines.
Default value: "\001\001"

refsect2.title: The "grid-line-width" style property
refsect2.para: Width, in pixels, of the tree view grid lines.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 1

refsect2.title: The "horizontal-separator" style property
refsect2.para: Horizontal space between cells. Must be an even number.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 2

refsect2.title: The "indent-expanders" style property
refsect2.para: Make the expanders indented.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "odd-row-color" style property
refsect2.para: Color to use for odd rows.

refsect2.title: The "row-ending-details" style property
refsect2.para: Enable extended row background theming.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "tree-line-pattern" style property
refsect2.para: Dash pattern used to draw the tree view lines.
Default value: "\001\001"

refsect2.title: The "tree-line-width" style property
refsect2.para: Width, in pixels, of the tree view lines.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 1

refsect2.title: The "vertical-separator" style property
refsect2.para: Vertical space between cells. Must be an even number.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 2

refsect2.title: The "columns-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The number of columns of the treeview has changed.

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "cursor-changed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkTreeView *tree_view, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The position of the cursor (focused cell) has changed.

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "expand-collapse-cursor-row" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *treeview, gboolean arg1, gboolean arg2, gboolean arg3, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "move-cursor" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *treeview, GtkMovementStep arg1, gint arg2, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "row-activated" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreePath *path, GtkTreeViewColumn *column, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The "row-activated" signal is emitted when the method gtk_tree_view_row_activated() is called or the user double clicks a treeview row. It is also emitted when a non-editable row is selected and one of the keys: Space, Shift+Space, Return or Enter is pressed.
For selection handling refer to the tree widget conceptual overview as well as GtkTreeSelection.

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
the GtkTreePath for the activated row
the GtkTreeViewColumn in which the activation occurred
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "row-collapsed" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeIter *iter, GtkTreePath *path, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The given row has been collapsed (child nodes are hidden).

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
the tree iter of the collapsed row
a tree path that points to the row
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "row-expanded" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeIter *iter, GtkTreePath *path, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The given row has been expanded (child nodes are shown).

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
the tree iter of the expanded row
a tree path that points to the row
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "select-all" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *treeview, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "select-cursor-parent" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *treeview, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "select-cursor-row" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *treeview, gboolean arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "set-scroll-adjustments" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkTreeView *horizontal, GtkAdjustment *vertical, GtkAdjustment *arg2, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: Set the scroll adjustments for the tree view. Usually scrolled containers like GtkScrolledWindow will emit this signal to connect two instances of GtkScrollbar to the scroll directions of the GtkTreeView.

listitem.simpara: the horizontal GtkAdjustment
the vertical GtkAdjustment
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "start-interactive-search" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *treeview, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "test-collapse-row" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeIter *iter, GtkTreePath *path, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The given row is about to be collapsed (hide its children nodes). Use this signal if you need to control the collapsibility of individual rows.

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
the tree iter of the row to collapse
a tree path that points to the row
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
FALSE to allow collapsing, TRUE to reject

refsect2.title: The "test-expand-row" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *tree_view, GtkTreeIter *iter, GtkTreePath *path, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The given row is about to be expanded (show its children nodes). Use this signal if you need to control the expandability of individual rows.

listitem.simpara: the object on which the signal is emitted
the tree iter of the row to expand
a tree path that points to the row
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
FALSE to allow expansion, TRUE to reject

refsect2.title: The "toggle-cursor-row" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *treeview, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "unselect-all" signal
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean user_function (GtkTreeView *treeview, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
